solution of a problem in concurrent programming controla number of mainly independent sequential-cyclicprocesses with restricted means of communication with each other can be made in such a way that at anymoment one and only one of them is engaged in the critical section of its cycle.cacm september 1965dijkstra e w.ca650908 jb march 6 1978 7:24 pm1198 5 11981198 5 11981198 5 11981781 5 11982150 5 11982228 5 11982256 5 11982317 5 11982342 5 11982376 5 11982618 5 11983184 5 1198123 6 1198196 6 1198919 6 1198990 6 11981007 6 11981046 6 11981131 6 11981139 6 11981140 6 11981149 6 11981198 6 11981198 6 11981198 6 11981198 6 11981198 6 11981198 6 11981198 6 11981198 6 11981198 6 11981215 6 11981223 6 11981265 6 11981303 6 11981323 6 11981338 6 11981338 6 11981338 6 11981338 6 11981338 6 11981358 6 11981366 6 11981421 6 11981460 6 11981462 6 11981463 6 11981467 6 11981468 6 11981477 6 11981491 6 11981496 6 11981531 6 11981535 6 11981565 6 11981572 6 11981601 6 11981602 6 11981613 6 11981614 6 11981626 6 11981641 6 11981693 6 11981749 6 11981749 6 11981749 6 11981749 6 11981749 6 11981749 6 11981753 6 11981781 6 11981787 6 11981788 6 1198205 6 1198224 6 1198249 6 11981877 6 1198288 6 11981960 6 1198316 6 1198381 6 1198398 6 119811 6 11982126 6 11982148 6 11982256 6 1198404 6 1198410 6 1198463 6 1198464 6 1198483 6 11983184 6 11983188 6 1198557 6 1198584 6 1198600 6 1198680 6 1198691 6 1198763 6 1198799 6 1198
